I installed new ram in ubuntu server and: Is it possible to update mobo bios through wine?
I don't think that would be safe imo
is there a way to natively update mobo bios?
not really, not unless if the mobo manufacturer does have flashing using linux method. I had to flash using liveUSB + FreeDOS + DOS flasher tool
can you help me or point me to how to do this?
is the bios flasher tool you got relies on DOS or does it actually require GUI interface?
checking to see if it needs GUI to flash
usually the motherboard website would detail that
for liveusb, is freedos the type of liveusb I need to create?

yes but I don't know of any guides off hand to make it work, I had use grub4dos and then loaded freeDOS iso image onto flash drive so that it would boot. You might find it a little easier if you could burn freeDOS iso onto maybe a CD or something
ASUS actually offers it's software for linux
I meant in terms of BIOS flashing, I know Gigabyte didn't they only had DOS flasher tools
I'm confused.  Do I still boot the ubuntu computer from a flash drive with freedos to upgrade the bios?
the flash utility is an .exe, so I'm assuming the answer is yes

no, you need to find out how does the flasher works, if the flasher is windows only tool (which means that it has GUI) you cannot use freeDOS. If the flasher tool is DOS based you can use FreeDOS to flash the BIOS which can be done either by burning a copy of freeDOS onto CD or using USB in addition with grub4dos. Otherwise if they have linux flasher tool, then I use that by all means
